  • Lectures
    • Lecture 0: Introduction to WILD6900
    • Lecture 1: Introduction to statistical inference in ecology
    • Lecture 2: Probability refresher (or introduction)
    • Lecture 3: Principles of Bayesian inference
    • Lecture 4: More about prior distributions
    • Lecture 5: Implementing Bayesian models: Introduction to MCMC samplers
    • Lecture 6: Introduction of Bayesian analysis using JAGS
    • Lecture 7: Generalized linear model review
    • Lecture 8: Introduction to hierarchical models
    • Lecture 9: Introduction to state-space models
  • Labs
    • Projects and directories
    • Introduction to R Markdown
    • Creating prior distributions
    • Simulating regression data
    • Metropolis sampler for linear regression model
    • Poisson and binomial GLMs in JAGS
    • Random effects ANCOVA in JAGS
    • Simple state-space models in JAGS
  • Assignments

Anticipated schedule (subject to change)

WILD 6900: Applied Bayesian Analysis of Ecological Data

Spring 2019

schedule.Rmd
Week (dates) Lecture topic Lab topic Reading
Unit 1: Foundations of Bayesian inference
1 (Jan. 8 & 10) Intro to WILD6900 and statistical modeling in ecology Projects and directories/ Intro to R Markdown H&H chp. 1
2 (Jan. 15 & 17) Probability models and stochasticity Manipulating, tidying, & visualizing data in R H&H chp. 2-3
3 (Jan. 22 & 24) Principles of Bayesian inference Data simulation techniques/Informative priors H&H chp. 5
4 (Jan. 29 & 31) Implementing Bayesian models: MCMC samplers and JAGS Building simple samplers in R H&H chp. 7
5 (Feb. 5 & 7) Generalized linear models/Hierarchical models Introduction to JAGS/ Regression analysis using JAGS H&H chp. 6, K&S chp. 3
Unit 2: Abundance and occupancy
6 (Feb. 12 & 14) Estimating indices of abundance from count data Poisson GLMM for count data K&S chp. 4
7 (Feb. 19 & 21) Estimating abundance from count data Basic N-mixture model & variations K&S chp. 12
8 (Feb. 26 & 28) Estimating occupancy from presence/absence data Static and dynamic occupancy models K&S chp. 13
9 (Mar. 5 & 7) Review/midterm Buffer
10 (Mar. 12 & 14) Spring break - no class Spring break - no class
11 (Mar. 19 & 21)
12 (Mar. 26 & 28)
13 (Apr. 2 & 5)
14 (Apr. 9 & 11)
15 (Apr. 16 & 18)
